SEARCH
Package com.karandev.util.net

Class TcpUtil

java.lang.Object
com.karandev.util.net.TcpUtil
public final class TcpUtil extends Object
Utility class for TCP socket operations, including sending and receiving primitive type values, texts and files.

Copyleft (c) 1993 by C and System Programmers Association (CSD) All Rights Free

Author:
JavaApp2-Jan-2024 Group

  • Method Details

    • getFirstAvailableSocket

      public static Optional<ServerSocket> getFirstAvailableSocket(int backlog, int minPort, int maxPort)

      Returns an Optional SocketServer with the first available port number in the given minPort, maxPort (inclusive) range, having the specified backlog value for maximum number of pending connections on the server socket. Other-wise returns an empty Optional.

      Parameters:
      backlog - requested maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      minPort - minimum value for the port number
      maxPort - maximum value for the port number
      Returns:
      an Optional SocketServer with given backlog value, or empty optional if all the ports are busy and cannot be assigned
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided port numbers are outside the valid range

    • getFirstAvailablePort

      public static Optional<ServerSocket> getFirstAvailablePort(int minPort, int maxPort)

      Returns an Optional SocketServer with the first available port number in the given minPort, maxPort (inclusive) range. Other-wise returns an empty Optional.

      Parameters:
      minPort - minimum value for the port number
      maxPort - maximum value for the port number
      Returns:
      an Optional SocketServer, or empty optional if all the ports are busy and cannot be assigned
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided port numbers are outside the valid range

    • getFirstAvailableSocket

      public static Optional<ServerSocket> getFirstAvailableSocket(int backlog, int... ports)

      Returns an Optional SocketServer with the first available port number in the given vararg parameter ports, and sets the maximum number of pending connections on the server socket using the backlog. Other-wise returns an empty Optional.

      Parameters:
      backlog - requested maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      ports - vararg parameter for the port number values
      Returns:
      an Optional SocketServer, or empty optional if all the ports are busy and cannot be assigned
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided port numbers are outside the valid range

    • getFirstAvailableSocket

      public static Optional<ServerSocket> getFirstAvailableSocket(int... ports)

      Returns an Optional SocketServer with the first available port number in the given vararg parameter ports. Other-wise returns an empty Optional.

      Parameters:
      ports - vararg parameter for the port number values
      Returns:
      an Optional SocketServer, or empty optional if all the ports are busy and cannot be assigned
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided port numbers are outside the valid range

    • receive

      public static int receive(Socket socket, byte[] data, int offset, int length)

      Receives length number of bytes from a socket, starting with index specified by offset and stores them into the specified byte array.

      This method relies on receive(DataInputStream, byte[], int, int) for handling byte-by-byte transfer and is called by receiveXXX methods for retrieving different types of data including primitive types.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      data - the byte array to store the read data from the socket
      offset - the starting index offset of the byte array
      length - the number of the bytes to be read
      Returns:
      the number of bytes read, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached before any data is read, or 0 when no bytes are read
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket

    • receive

      public static int receive(Socket socket, byte[] data)

      Receives data.length number of bytes from a socket, starting from index number 0 and stores them into the specified byte array.

      This method relies on receive(Socket, byte[], int, int) for handling byte-by-byte transfer and is called by receiveXXX methods for retrieving different types of data including primitive types.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      data - the byte array to store the read data from the socket
      Returns:
      the number of bytes read, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached before any data is read, or 0 when no bytes are read
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket

    • send

      public static int send(Socket socket, byte[] data, int offset, int length)

      Sends length number of bytes over a socket, starting with index specified by offset.

      This method relies on send(DataOutputStream, byte[], int, int) for handling byte-by-byte transfer and is called by sendXXX methods for sending different types of data including primitive types.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      data - the byte array used for sending the data through the socket
      offset - the starting index offset of the byte array to be sent
      length - the maximum length of data from the byte array to be sent
      Returns:
      the total number of bytes sent through the socket
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket

    • send

      public static int send(Socket socket, byte[] data)

      Sends data.length number of bytes over a socket, starting from index number 0.

      Number of bytes to read is as long as the incoming data and starting offset is 0.

      This method relies on send(Socket, byte[], int, int) for handling byte-by-byte transfer and is called by sendXXX methods for sending different types of data including primitive types.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      data - the byte array used for sending the data through the socket
      Returns:
      the total number of bytes sent through the socket
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket

    • receiveByte

      public static byte receiveByte(Socket socket)

      Receives a single byte from the socket

      This method allocates a buffer for a byte and calls receive(Socket, byte[]).

      Received byte is returned.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      Returns:
      the received byte value
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket

    • receiveShort

      public static short receiveShort(Socket socket)

      Receives a short value from the socket

      This method allocates a buffer for 2 bytes and calls receive(Socket, byte[]). Byte array filled by incoming data is converted to short by BitConverter.toShort(byte[]) and returned.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      Returns:
      the received short value
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      Returns:
      the received int value
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket

    • receiveStringViaLength

      public static String receiveStringViaLength(Socket socket)

      Receives a length-prefixed string str from a socket using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8

      This method consecutively receives specified str's length and then the string itself from the specified socket.

      In order to successfully receive length-prefixed strings, sender must use matching sendStringViaLength(Socket, String, Charset) method.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      Returns:
      the received string
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket

    • receiveStringViaLength

      public static String receiveStringViaLength(Socket socket, Charset charset)

      Receives a length-prefixed string str from a socket using specified charset

      This method consecutively receives specified str's length and then the string itself from the specified socket.

      In order to successfully receive length-prefixed strings, sender must use matching sendStringViaLength(Socket, String, Charset) method.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      charset - the charset of the text
      Returns:
      the received string
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      See Also:
      • sendStringViaLength(Socket, String, Charset)

    • receiveLine

      public static String receiveLine(Socket socket)

      Receives a line of text from the specified socket, using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8 for decoding the received data and reading it in blocks of default block size DEFAULT_LINE_BLOCK_SIZE. The method stops reading when a newline character `\n` is detected and returns the assembled line of text.

      This method will work properly if the sender closes the socket after the send process.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      Returns:
      the received text
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      NullPointerException - if socket is null or charset is null
      NegativeArraySizeException - blockSize is less than zero
      See Also:
      • receiveLine(Socket, Charset, int)

    • receiveLine

      public static String receiveLine(Socket socket, Charset charset)

      Receives a line of text from the specified socket, using the specified charset for decoding the received data and reading it in blocks of default block size DEFAULT_LINE_BLOCK_SIZE. The method stops reading when a newline character `\n` is detected and returns the assembled line of text.

      This method will work properly if the sender closes the socket after the send process.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      charset - the charset of the text
      Returns:
      the received text
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      NullPointerException - if socket is null or charset is null
      NegativeArraySizeException - blockSize is less than zero
      See Also:
      • receiveLine(Socket, Charset, int)

    • receiveLine

      public static String receiveLine(Socket socket, int blockSize)

      Receives a line of text from the specified socket, using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8 for decoding the received data and reading it in blocks of the specified blockSize. The method stops reading when a newline character `\n` is detected and returns the assembled line of text.

      This method will work properly if the sender closes the socket after the send process.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      blockSize - block size of the internal buffer. If zero, no data is read
      Returns:
      the received text
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      NullPointerException - if socket is null or charset is null
      NegativeArraySizeException - blockSize is less than zero
      See Also:
      • receiveLine(Socket, Charset, int)

    • receiveLine

      public static String receiveLine(Socket socket, Charset charset, int blockSize)

      Receives a line of text from the specified socket, using the provided charset for decoding the received data and reading it in blocks of the specified blockSize. The method stops reading when a newline character `\n` is detected and returns the assembled line of text.

      This method reads data from the socket in chunks of the given block size, converting each chunk from byte data into a string using the specified charset. It appends the received data to a StringBuilder until it encounters a newline character. If the newline is found in the middle of a chunk, only the portion up to the newline is appended, and reading stops. Otherwise, the entire chunk is appended, and the method continues reading more data.

      This method will work properly if the sender closes the socket after the send process.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      charset - the charset of the text
      blockSize - block size of the internal buffer. If zero, no data is read
      Returns:
      the received text
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      NullPointerException - if socket is null or charset is null
      NegativeArraySizeException - blockSize is less than zero

    • receiveLines

      public static String[] receiveLines(Socket socket)

      Receives multiple lines of text from the specified socket, using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8 for decoding and reading data in blocks of default block size DEFAULT_LINE_BLOCK_SIZE. The method returns an array of strings, where each element represents a separate line of text. It reads the full content from the socket and splits it into individual lines based on newline characters.

      This method functions the same way as receiveLines(Socket, Charset, int), except that it uses default block sizeDEFAULT_LINE_BLOCK_SIZE and default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      Returns:
      all received lines from the socket in a string array
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      See Also:
      • receiveLines(Socket, Charset, int)

    • receiveLines

      public static String[] receiveLines(Socket socket, Charset charset)

      Receives multiple lines of text from the specified socket, using the provided charset for decoding and reading data in blocks of default block size DEFAULT_LINE_BLOCK_SIZE. The method returns an array of strings, where each element represents a separate line of text. It reads the full content from the socket and splits it into individual lines based on newline characters.

      This method functions the same way as receiveLines(Socket, Charset, int), except that it uses default block sizeDEFAULT_LINE_BLOCK_SIZE

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      charset - the charset of the text
      Returns:
      all received lines from the socket in a string array
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      See Also:
      • receiveLines(Socket, Charset, int)

    • receiveLines

      public static String[] receiveLines(Socket socket, int blockSize)

      Receives multiple lines of text from the specified socket, using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8 for decoding and reading data in blocks of the specified blockSize. The method returns an array of strings, where each element represents a separate line of text. It reads the full content from the socket and splits it into individual lines based on newline characters.

      This method functions the same way as receiveLines(Socket, Charset, int), except that it uses default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      blockSize - block size of the internal buffer. If zero, no data is read
      Returns:
      all received lines from the socket in a string array
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket
      See Also:
      • receiveLines(Socket, Charset, int)

    • receiveLines

      public static String[] receiveLines(Socket socket, Charset charset, int blockSize)

      Receives multiple lines of text from the specified socket, using the provided charset for decoding and reading data in blocks of the specified blockSize. The method returns an array of strings, where each element represents a separate line of text. It reads the full content from the socket and splits it into individual lines based on newline characters.

      This method relies on the receiveLine(Socket, Charset, int) method to receive a single line of text. Once a full block of data is read, it splits the result using a regular expression to handle both Unix-style `\n` and Windows-style `\r\n` line endings.

      This method will work properly if sender close socket after the send process

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      charset - the charset of the text
      blockSize - block size of the internal buffer
      Returns:
      all received lines from the socket in a string array
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket

    • receiveFile

      public static void receiveFile(Socket socket, File file)

      Receives a file from the socket and writes it to the path contained in File object.

      This method functions the same way as receiveFile(Socket, String), except that it uses the absolute path obtained from File object, instead of using string for path argument.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      file - File object for saving the received file
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket

    • receiveFile

      public static void receiveFile(Socket socket, String path)

      Receives a file from the socket and writes it to specified path.

      This method is to be used with sendFile(Socket, String, int) and expects to receive the remaining length of the transfer in order to properly receive file.

      This method instantiates a FileOutputStream object with specified path, allocates a buffer area of file size via calling receiveInt(Socket), then loops until no file chunks remain. Finally the resulting file data is written via calling FileOutputStream's write method with the resulting byte array and with a starting offset of 0.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      path - the path for saving the received file
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while receiving from the socket

    • sendByte

      public static void sendByte(Socket socket, byte val)

      Sends a single byte value to the socket

      This method allocates a new byte buffer via BitConverter.getBytes(byte) and calls send(Socket, byte[]) with the return value.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      val - the byte value to send
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket

      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket

    • sendStringViaLength

      public static void sendStringViaLength(Socket socket, String str)

      Sends a length-prefixed string str to a socket using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8

      This method consecutively sends specified str's length and then the string itself using the specified socket.

      In order to successfully receive length-prefixed strings, receiver must use matching receiveStringViaLength(Socket) method

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      str - the string to send
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
      See Also:
      • receiveStringViaLength(Socket)

    • sendStringViaLength

      public static void sendStringViaLength(Socket socket, String str, Charset charset)

      Sends a length-prefixed string str to a socket using specified charset

      This method consecutively sends specified str's length and then the string itself using the specified socket.

      In order to successfully receive length-prefixed strings, receiver must use matching receiveStringViaLength(Socket, Charset) method

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      str - the string to send
      charset - the charset of the text
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
      See Also:
      • receiveStringViaLength(Socket, Charset)

    • sendString

      public static void sendString(Socket socket, String str)

      Sends the str to the socket using the default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      str - the string to send
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket

    • sendString

      public static void sendString(Socket socket, String str, Charset charset)

      Sends the str to the socket using the specified charset.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      str - the string to send
      charset - the charset of the text
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket

    • sendLine

      public static void sendLine(Socket socket, String str)

      Takes the text str, terminates it by line break and sends it to the socket, using the default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      str - the text to send
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket

    • sendLine

      public static void sendLine(Socket socket, String str, Charset charset)

      Takes the text str, terminates it by line break and sends it to socket, using the specified charset.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      str - the text to send
      charset - the charset of the text
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket

    • sendFile

      public static void sendFile(Socket socket, File file, int blockSize)

      Sends a file over the socket with specified block size.

      This method functions the same way as sendFile(Socket, String, int), except that it requires a File object.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      file - the file to send
      blockSize - block size of the internal buffer
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket

    • sendFile

      public static void sendFile(Socket socket, String path, int blockSize)

      Sends a file on given path over the socket with specified blockSize.

      This method allocates a byte array of blockSize and pushes the file in path into a FileInputStream. Then loops by sending transferred byte amount and the actual data until EOF condition is met.

      Parameters:
      socket - any valid and open socket
      path - the path to the file to send
      blockSize - block size of the internal buffer
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending through the socket
